title: Can music be copyrighted on Instagram? - Quora

response.answer_text: Many people are confused and have a question in mind- Can I post copyrighted music on Instagram. And the answer is Yes, if you do it in the right way. Many of the posts get deleted by Instagram due to the use of copyright music. There are several ways to avoid copyright issue on Instagram, but the following ways are guaranteed: 1. Give full credit to the owner of the music 2. Always appeal to Instagram's decision 3. Better ask before posting 4. Use copyrighted free music in your video 5. Make a slight change in original music By following these points, your copyrighted music post will not get deleted, and you won't face any copyrighted music issue.

Yes, The algorithm Instagram uses is similar to the one YouTube has employed to tag users that have copyrighted music in the background of their videos. ... The good news is that you can still post the video later by appealing the removal if you have permission or plan to get permission to use the music, But if you have a private account on Instagram then you don’t need to worry about it.

Under US law, all recorded music is copyrighted. So, yes, they do allow copyrighted music — they have to, in order to have any music at all. What the law does not allow, and Instagram likely has measures in place to prevent, is the use of copyrighted music without permission.
